# Identity

## Classification

The **Common Blue butterfly** or the *Polyommatus icarus* belongs to the family of the **Lycaenidae** and to the subfamily of the **Polyommatinae**.  

![](Common_blue_butterfly_(Polyommatus_icarus)_male_3.jpg)
This image is taken from Wikipedia.

## Geographic range

These flying insects are found mostly in Europe, North Africa, the Canary Islands, and east across the Palearctic to Northern China. These butterflies inhabit flowery or grassy places, warm or cool, in woodland clearings, sand dunes, under cliffs, etc.
